item.title: 米莱紧缩政策重创阿根廷，贫困率飙升至 50
item.description: 今年上半年，随着哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）总统推出休克疗法计划，阿根廷的贫困率达到了自 2001 年金融危机以来的最高水平，目的是让本已衰退的经济重新站起来。【原文：Poverty in Argentina reached its highest level since the aftermath of the 2001 financial crisis in the first half of the year, as President Javier Milei unleashed a shock therapy program to put an already reeling economy back on its feet.】

item.title: Zip 公司飙升 937% 位居全球支付类股之首，美国前景看好
item.description: 澳大利亚 Zip 公司已成为过去一年中全球表现最好的数字支付股票，因为交易员们寄希望于降息和控制成本能促进其美国业务的发展。【原文：Australia’s Zip Co. has become the best performing digital payments stock in the world over the past year as traders wager on a boost for its US business from interest-rate cuts and a focus on curbing costs.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行鹰派的利率路径让布洛克在世界经济放缓之际坐上了热搜榜
item.description: 米歇尔-布洛克（Michele Bullock）担任澳大利亚央行行长已有一年，她正面临着多方面的挑战。而且，这些不利因素很可能会愈演愈烈。【原文：A year into her term as Australia’s central bank governor, Michele Bullock is facing headwinds on multiple fronts. They’re only likely to intensify.】

item.title: 尼尔森-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）女婿退出特里安公司后将寻求激进资金
item.description: 在离开与岳父纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）共同创办的激进主义公司一年多后，埃德-加登正准备管理外部资本。【原文：Ed Garden is preparing to manage outside capital more than a year after leaving the activist firm he co-founded with his father-in-law, Nelson Peltz.】

item.title: Carahsoft 老板在联邦调查局突袭前靠政府销售建立帝国
item.description: 四年前，SAP SE 高管马克-特斯托尼（Mark Testoni）和大型软件转售商 Carahsoft Technology Corp. 的总裁兼创始人克雷格-阿博德（Craig Abod）站在卓越销售协会（Institute for Excellence in Sales）组织的一次活动的讲台上。【原文：Four years ago, Mark Testoni, an SAP SE executive, and Craig Abod, the president and founder of giant software reseller Carahsoft Technology Corp., stood at the podium of an event organized by the Institute for Excellence in Sales.】

item.title: 比特币在 58 亿美元期权到期前突破 65,000 美元
item.description: 在周五期权合约到期之前，比特币在四周内首次升至 65,000 美元以上，一些分析师称，这可能会导致加密货币市场波动加剧。【原文：Bitcoin rose above $65,000 for the first time in four weeks before the expiration of options contracts on Friday that some analysts say may result in heightened volatility in the cryptocurrency market.】

item.title: 高盛集团的鲁布纳认为大选后 "买入中国 "的贸易游戏将上演
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）全球市场董事总经理兼战术专家斯科特-鲁布纳（Scott Rubner）表示，中国股市一路高歌猛进，纳斯达克金龙指数（Nasdaq Golden Dragon Index）在过去四天内飙升了 19%，美国大选结束后，中国股市应成为投资者计划中的关键部分。【原文：Chinese stocks have been on a tear, with the Nasdaq Golden Dragon Index soaring 19% in the last four days, and the shares should be a key part of investors’ plans once the US election is over, according to Scott Rubner, managing director for global markets and tactical specialist at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: Vivek Chibber 谈产业政策的成功之道
item.description:
我们能从这些花费中得到我们想要的东西吗？【原文：

Will we get what we want out of all of this money being spent?

】

item.title: 金融科技公司 Chime 委托摩根士丹利处理 2025 年首次公开募股事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，专注于免收费服务的金融科技公司 Chime Financial Inc.【原文：Chime Financial Inc., a financial technology business focused on fee-free services, has tapped Morgan Stanley to lead its initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Robinhood 和 Revolut 探讨加入价值 1700 亿美元的稳定币市场
item.description: 从Robinhood Markets Inc.到Revolut Ltd.等公司都在考虑推出稳定币，押注欧洲和其他地区更严格的监管最终会放松Tether Holdings Ltd.对迅速扩张的价值1700亿美元的数字资产领域的控制。【原文：Companies from Robinhood Markets Inc. to Revolut Ltd. are considering launching stablecoins, betting that stricter regulations in Europe and elsewhere will finally loosen Tether Holdings Ltd.’s grip on the rapidly expanding $170 billion digital-asset sector.】

item.title: 智利改革是促进 "拉美化 "增长的关键：S&P
item.description: S&P全球评级公司对智利重新重视经济改革表示欢迎，称这对加快增长和控制债务水平至关重要。【原文：S&P Global Ratings welcomed Chile’s renewed focus on economic reforms, saying they were central to accelerating growth and keeping debt levels under control.】

item.title: 软银支持的 Swiggy 申请在印度首次出售股份
item.description: 印度食品配送平台 Swiggy Ltd. 提交了首次公开募股文件，预计这将是印度今年最大的首次公开募股之一。【原文：Indian food-delivery platform Swiggy Ltd. filed documents for an initial public offering in what is expected to be one of the nation’s biggest this year.】

item.title: 安哥拉与 Starlink 就引入卫星服务进行谈判
item.description: 安哥拉说，它正在与埃隆-马斯克的Starlink公司商谈，将卫星服务引入这个非洲西南部国家。【原文：Angola said it is in talks with Elon Musk’s Starlink Inc about introducing the satellite service to the southwest African nation.】

item.title: SAP 内部调查显示员工士气在重组中急剧下降
item.description: 据一项内部调查显示，随着首席执行官克里斯蒂安-克莱因（Christian Klein）推进一月份宣布的重组计划，SAP SE 在其本土市场正面临着员工不满情绪的膨胀。【原文：SAP SE is facing swelling discontent among employees in its home market, according to an internal survey, as Chief Executive Officer Christian Klein pushes through a restructuring plan announced in January.】

item.title: Thoma Bravo 寻找潜在的拉美软件交易
item.description: 以技术为重点的收购公司 Thoma Bravo LLC 已在拉丁美洲确定了三、四家公司作为该地区的潜在目标。【原文：Technology-focused buyout firm Thoma Bravo LLC has identified three or four companies in Latin America as potential targets in the region.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率连续第三周下降至两年来最低水平
item.description: 抵押贷款利率降至两年来的最低点，有助于推动购房者重返房地产市场。【原文：Mortgage rates dropped to the lowest in two years, helping push buyers back into the housing market.】

item.title: 英国推迟提供长效艾滋病预防药物
item.description: 英国药品定价监管机构拒绝推荐葛兰素史克公司（GSK Plc）的长效预防艾滋病注射剂，要求该公司提供更多数据，这一决定进一步推迟了该国患者获得这种药品的时间。【原文：England’s drug pricing regulator declined to recommend GSK Plc’s long-acting HIV prevention injection, asking the company for more data, in a decision that further delays access to the medicine for patients in the country.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会主席詹斯勒仍认为交易所注册存在监管空白
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会并没有放弃强制另类交易系统在该机构注册为经纪人的提议。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission isn’t giving up on a proposal to force alternative trading systems to register as brokers with the agency.】

item.title: 部长称加拿大缺乏人工智能框架 "令人尴尬
item.description: 加拿大工业部长表示，目前在通过人工智能框架方面面临的挑战对加拿大来说并不乐观。如果贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）总理的少数党政府比预期的更早倒台，那么这项法律甚至可能永远见不到阳光。【原文：Canada’s industry minister says ongoing challenges to adopt an artificial intelligence framework do not look good for the country. The law may never even see the light of day if Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s minority government falls sooner than expected.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，继兴登堡报告后，超微公司遭美国调查
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，超级微电脑公司正在接受美国司法部的调查，因为一份做空报告引发了对该公司会计实务的质疑。【原文：Super Micro Computer Inc. is under investigation by the US Justice Department following a short-seller report that raised questions about the company’s accounting practices, the Wall Street Journal reported.】

item.title: 美国联邦通信委员会对拜登抢答器处以 600 万美元罚款
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会对史蒂夫-克莱默（Steve Kramer）处以 600 万美元的罚款，他是数千个模仿乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统声音的机器人电话的幕后黑手。【原文：The US Federal Communications Commission levied a $6 million fine on Steve Kramer, the perpetrator behind thousands of robocalls that mimicked President Joe Biden’s voice.】

item.title: OpenAI 可能会成为一家公益公司。这意味着什么？
item.description: OpenAI 的管理者正在权衡是否要将这家快速发展的人工智能先驱转变为一家公益公司（PBC），不再由其非盈利董事会控制。【原文：OpenAI’s managers are weighing whether to turn the fast-growing artificial intelligence pioneer into a public benefit corporation (PBC) that would no longer be controlled by its nonprofit board.】

item.title: 瑞银称墨西哥比索将因政治不确定性减弱而上涨
item.description: 据瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）称，随着投资者对新政府越来越放心，以及围绕美国大选的波动逐渐减弱，墨西哥比索将在明年上半年走强。【原文：Mexico’s peso is set to strengthen through the first half of next year as investors grow more comfortable with the new administration and volatility around the US election fades, according to UBS Group AG.】

item.title: 电气化主题 ETF 最新加入人工智能 "淘金热
item.description: 这是主题 ETF 投资热潮中的最新交易：搭上人工智能革命快车的能源公司。【原文：It’s the latest trade in the buzzy world of thematic ETF investing: Energy companies that are riding the AI revolution.】

item.title: Visa 通过购买功能空间加强人工智能反欺诈斗争
item.description: Visa 公司将收购实时人工智能支付保护公司 Featurespace Ltd.—；这是这家信用卡巨头加强欺诈和金融犯罪风险检测组合的最新举措。【原文：Visa Inc. will acquire real-time artificial intelligence payments protection firm Featurespace Ltd. — marking the credit-card giant’s latest move in bolstering its fraud and financial crime risk detection portfolio.】

item.title: OpenAI的阿尔特曼称高管离职与重组无关
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）表示，这家人工智能初创公司的高管离职与公司权衡向营利性结构转型时进行的重组无关。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said that executive departures at the artificial intelligence startup were unrelated to a restructuring as the company weighs moving to a for-profit structure.】

item.title: 巴尔称美联储正在探索将流动性与未保险存款挂钩
item.description: 美国央行正在探索调整其流动性框架，包括寻求保护未投保储户的要求。【原文：The US central bank is exploring adjustments to its liquidity framework, including requirements that would seek to protect uninsured depositors.】

item.title: 雪佛龙同意赫斯首席执行官不加入董事会，与美国联邦贸易委员会达成协议
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.熟悉内情的人士说，作为与美国联邦贸易委员会达成的允许两家公司合并的协议的一部分，雪佛龙公司首席执行官约翰-赫斯（John Hess）不会加入该公司董事会。【原文：Chevron Corp. agreed that Hess Corp. Chief Executive Officer John Hess won’t join the company’s board as part of an agreement with the US Federal Trade Commission allowing the companies’ merger to proceed, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 意大利工业部长支持意大利联合信贷银行与德国商业银行的交易
item.description: 意大利工业部长阿道夫-乌尔索（Adolfo Urso）支持总部设在米兰的意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）收购德国商业银行股份公司（Commerzbank AG），这有可能使柏林和罗马之间的关系恶化。【原文：Italy’s Industry Minister Adolfo Urso backed a potential takeover of Commerzbank AG by Milan-based UniCredit SpA which has threatened to sour relations between Berlin and Rome.】

item.title: 花旗分析师认为裕信银行与德国商业银行的交易是大概率事件
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc）分析师表示，尽管德国政府反对，但意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）和德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）仍有可能合并。【原文：A merger between UniCredit SpA and Commerzbank AG is likely, despite opposition from the German government, according to analysts at Citigroup Inc.】
